axioms.name: Definition of Limit (ε-δ)
axioms.statement: A sequence {a_n} converges to a limit L if for every ε > 0 there exists N such that for all n ≥ N, |a_n - L| < ε.

axioms.name: Uniqueness of Limits
axioms.statement: A sequence can have at most one limit.

axioms.name: Algebra of Limits
axioms.statement: If {a_n} → A and {b_n} → B, then {a_n + b_n} → A + B and {a_n b_n} → AB.

axioms.name: Order Preservation of Limits
axioms.statement: If {a_n} → A and {b_n} → B and a_n ≤ b_n for all n, then A ≤ B.

axioms.name: Squeeze Theorem
axioms.statement: If a_n ≤ b_n ≤ c_n for all n, and {a_n} → L and {c_n} → L, then {b_n} → L.

axioms.name: Definition of Continuity (ε-δ)
axioms.statement: A function f is continuous at a point c if for every ε > 0 there exists δ > 0 such that for all x, if |x - c| < δ then |f(x) - f(c)| < ε.

axioms.name: Composition of Continuous Functions
axioms.statement: If f and g are continuous, then f ∘ g is continuous.

axioms.name: Extreme Value Theorem
axioms.statement: A continuous function on a closed interval [a, b] attains its maximum and minimum values.

axioms.name: Intermediate Value Theorem
axioms.statement: If f is continuous on [a, b] and k is between f(a) and f(b), then there exists c ∈ (a, b) such that f(c) = k.

axioms.name: Monotone Convergence Theorem
axioms.statement: Every bounded, monotone sequence converges.

axioms.name: Bolzano–Weierstrass Theorem
axioms.statement: Every bounded sequence has a convergent subsequence.

axioms.name: Cauchy Criterion for Sequences
axioms.statement: A sequence {a_n} converges if and only if it is a Cauchy sequence.

axioms.name: Cauchy Criterion for Functions
axioms.statement: A function is uniformly continuous on an interval if and only if every Cauchy sequence of points maps to a Cauchy sequence.

axioms.name: Definition of Uniform Continuity
axioms.statement: f is uniformly continuous on A if for every ε > 0 there exists δ > 0 such that for all x, y ∈ A, |x - y| < δ implies |f(x) - f(y)| < ε.

axioms.name: Uniform Continuity on Closed Interval
axioms.statement: Every continuous function on a closed interval [a, b] is uniformly continuous.

axioms.name: Heine–Borel Theorem
axioms.statement: A subset of ℝ is compact if and only if it is closed and bounded.

axioms.name: Compactness and Sequential Compactness
axioms.statement: A subset of ℝ^n is compact if and only if every sequence has a convergent subsequence.

axioms.name: Definition of Derivative
axioms.statement: The derivative of f at c is defined as f'(c) = lim_{h→0} (f(c+h) - f(c))/h, if the limit exists.

axioms.name: Mean Value Theorem
axioms.statement: If f is continuous on [a, b] and differentiable on (a, b), then there exists c in (a, b) such that f'(c) = (f(b) - f(a)) / (b - a).

axioms.name: Taylor's Theorem (First Order)
axioms.statement: If f is differentiable, then f(x) ≈ f(a) + f'(a)(x - a) for x near a.

axioms.name: Convergence of Series
axioms.statement: A series ∑a_n converges if the sequence of partial sums s_n = a₁ + ... + aₙ converges.

axioms.name: Comparison Test
axioms.statement: If 0 ≤ a_n ≤ b_n and ∑b_n converges, then ∑a_n also converges.

axioms.name: Ratio Test
axioms.statement: If lim |aₙ₊₁/aₙ| = L < 1, then ∑aₙ converges.

axioms.name: Alternating Series Test
axioms.statement: If a_n is decreasing and lim a_n = 0, then ∑(-1)ⁿa_n converges.

axioms.name: Absolute vs Conditional Convergence
axioms.statement: Absolutely convergent series are convergent. The converse is not necessarily true.

axioms.name: Definition of Uniform Convergence
axioms.statement: fₙ → f uniformly if for every ε > 0 there exists N such that for all n ≥ N, sup_x |fₙ(x) - f(x)| < ε.

axioms.name: Uniform Limit Theorem
axioms.statement: If fₙ → f uniformly and each fₙ is continuous, then f is continuous.

axioms.name: Term-by-Term Integration
axioms.statement: If fₙ → f uniformly on [a, b], then ∫fₙ → ∫f as n → ∞.

axioms.name: Term-by-Term Differentiation
axioms.statement: If fₙ → f uniformly and fₙ′ → g uniformly, then f is differentiable and f′ = g.

axioms.name: Partial Derivative Definition
axioms.statement: The partial derivative ∂f/∂x at (x, y) is defined as lim_{h→0} (f(x+h, y) - f(x, y))/h, if the limit exists.

axioms.name: Schwarz's Theorem (Clairaut's Theorem)
axioms.statement: If f_x_y and f_y_x are continuous, then f_x_y = f_y_x.

axioms.name: Multivariable Chain Rule
axioms.statement: If f is differentiable and g is differentiable, then the derivative of the composition is the product of their Jacobians.

axioms.name: Mean Value Theorem (Multivariable)
axioms.statement: If f is differentiable on a convex open set, then there exists c on the line segment such that f(b) - f(a) = ∇f(c) ⋅ (b - a).

axioms.name: Definition of Measurable Set
axioms.statement: A subset A ⊆ ℝ is Lebesgue measurable if for every ε > 0, there exists an open set O ⊇ A such that m*(O \ A) < ε.

axioms.name: Dominated Convergence Theorem
axioms.statement: If fₙ → f a.e. and |fₙ| ≤ g where g is integrable, then ∫fₙ → ∫f.

axioms.name: Monotone Convergence Theorem (Lebesgue)
axioms.statement: If fₙ ↑ f and fₙ ≥ 0, then ∫fₙ → ∫f.
